entry.name: removeAttr
entry.title: .removeAttr()

argument.name: attributeName
argument.desc: An attribute to remove; as of version 1.7, it can be a space-separated list of attributes.

entry.desc: Remove an attribute from each element in the set of matched elements.

longdesc.p: The .removeAttr() method uses the JavaScript removeAttribute() function, but it has the advantage of being able to be called directly on a jQuery object and it accounts for different attribute naming across browsers.
Note: Removing an inline onclick event handler using .removeAttr() doesn't achieve the desired effect in Internet Explorer 6, 7, or 8. To avoid potential problems, use .prop() instead:

example.desc: Clicking the button enables the input next to it.
